text: Three is a 1969 British drama film written and directed by James Salter. The film stars Charlotte Rampling, Robie Porter, Sam Waterston, Pascale Roberts, Edina Ronay and Gillian Hills. The film was released on December 23, 1969, by United Artists. Locations: # Biarritz, Pyrénées-Atlantiques, France (Picnic on seawall scene, late in film) ==Synopsis== Two American college friends are on a trip in Europe near the Mediterranean. Although they meet a lot of women, a particular English tourist catches their attention, so they decided to become friends with her. ==Cast== *Charlotte Rampling as Marty *Robie Porter as Bert *Sam Waterston as Taylor *Pascale Roberts as Claude *Edina Ronay as Liz *Gillian Hills as Ann *Alfredo Rizzo as Waiter *Paul Cooper as Photographer *Patrizia Giammei as Gloria *Mario Cotone as Silvano *Franca Tasso as Hélène *Roberto Scheiber as Piero ==References== ==External links== * Category:1969 films Category:British films Category:English-language films Category:British drama films Category:1969 drama films Category:United Artists films Category:Films scored by Laurence Rosenthal
title: Three (1969 film)
